info.title: Dynatrace Cluster API
info.description:
Dynatrace Managed exposes cluster management functionality via REST endpoints. This interactive documentation also acts as a REST client you can use to interact with Dynatrace Managed clusters. 

To authorize, use the API Token generated in [Settings - API Tokens page](/cmc#cm/apiToken). The HTTP status code of the response shows the result of your request. The expected response code for a successful request is documented individually per REST endpoint. Additionally the following error response codes can occur in our REST interface:

* 400 - Bad Request: Some request parameters are not correct. See response body for details.
* 401 - Unauthorized: A valid authorization header is required but is missing.
* 403 - Forbidden: Execution of request is not allowed, e.g. api-token is invalid.
* 404 - Not Found: Endpoint does not exist or some entities could not be found, e.g. User account.
* 500 - Internal Server Error: See response body for details.
* 556 - Upgrade in progress: Operation couldn't be performed during the upgrade.

parameters.name: dir
parameters.description: Backup store directory path parameter. Missing or empty values will return a 'Bad Request'

parameters.name: datacenter

put.summary: Override cassandra read quorum at runtime only for this particular server instance
put.description:
This API allows you to override cassandra read quorum of this particular server instance. Other server instances are not affected.

Note that this will not be persisted, after server restart this override will be lost!

Typically you only need it in multi-datacenter fail-over scenarios. 

 To reset the overrides call the API with the UNSET value.

get.summary: Get the cassandra read quorum override.
get.description: Does not return actual used read quorum if no override is set, in this case UNSET is returned.
Responses with status of current node removal (if it's already running) and statuses of historical removals.

207.description: Node not found by id or IP address

505.description: Node joining operation is in progress

506.description: Node removal operation is in progress

530.description: Offline node removal operation error. Cleaning cluster configuration was not completed

533.description: Node removal operation is not allowed. Upgrade is in progress.

534.description: Node removal operation is not allowed. Cassandra nodes are not in valid state (UN).

535.description: Node removal operation is not allowed. Elasticsearch is sharding data.

post.summary: Initialize verification if a node can be added to the cluster

get.summary: Verification if a node can be added to the cluster status

put.summary: Override which nodes can perform internal responsibilities
put.description:
This API allows you to define which nodes can perform cluster-wide responsibilities, for example metric aging or problem detection, by specifying nodes IDs. 

Typically you only need it in multi-datacenter fail-over scenarios. 

 To reset the overrides call the API with an empty list of node IDs.

put.summary: Modify update package state. Particular package might be excluded from download or re-downloaded.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Installation package type, possible values = "SERVER, AGENT, JS_AGENT, SG, NGINX"

requestBody.description: The JSON body of the request. Contains parameters of update entry configuration.

200.description: Successfully scheduled. Package should be excluded/re-downloaded soon.

404.description: Specified installation package was not found.

412.description: Operation is not allowed. See response message for more details.

510.description: Operation failed. Check server logs for more details.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Installation package type, possible values = "SERVER, AGENT, JS_AGENT, SG, NGINX"

200.description: Successfully scheduled. Package should be removed from all nodes within a couple of minutes.

404.description: Specified installation package was not found.

412.description: Removing installation files is not allowed. Update list is synchronized with Mission Control.

510.description: Operation failed. Check server logs for more details.

412.description: Triggering of upgrade failed due to missing new version on all nodes.

510.description: Could not trigger upgrade. Check logs for details...

553.description: Upgrade suspended by Dynatrace Mission Control. Could not upgrade cluster now.

400.description: No group information received for the create-group request

406.description: Unacceptable or incomplete request. Some groups were added.

requestBody.description:
Request body used for updating existing user group. 
For updating user group set correct 'id', not setting 'id' will return 'Bad Request'. 
Trying to change group name to one that already exists will return 'Bad Request'. 
Trying to update group that doesn't exist will return 'Not Acceptable'.
'isAccessAccount' value is ignored when 'Dynatrace Platform Subscription' is not in use.

400.description:
Operation failed. The input is invalid. Possible reasons:
 - No group information received for the request to create a group
 - Group ID is not set
 - Group name cannot be null or empty
 - At least one of the specified environments doesn't exist

406.description: Not acceptable. Group name already exists or group not found

requestBody.description:
Request body used for creating new user group. 
For creating user group leave 'id' empty, setting 'id' will return 'Bad Request'. 
Trying to create group with name that already exists will return 'Not Acceptable'.
'isAccessAccount' value is ignored when 'Dynatrace Platform Subscription' is not in use.

400.description:
Operation failed. The input is invalid. Possible reasons:
 - No group information received for the request to create a group
 - Group ID cannot be set
 - Group name cannot be null or empty
 - At least one of the specified environments doesn't exist

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Group ID path parameter. Missing or empty values will return a 'Bad Request'.

404.description: Not found

parameters.description: Group ID path parameter. Missing or empty values will return a 'Bad Request'.

get.summary: Get management zone permissions for all groups
get.description: This is a list of management zone specific permissions only. Environment permissions are not taken into account here. Groups with permissions for whole environments can also see all management zones defined in these environments, even if they have no management zone specific permissions and the list returned by this request is empty.

put.summary: Update management zone permissions for a single group

400.description: Provided model is incorrect or is missing required elements

404.description: A group, environment or management zone does not exist

get.summary: Get management zone permissions for a given group
get.description: This is a list of management zone specific permissions only. Environment permissions are not taken into account here. Groups with permissions for whole environments can also see all management zones defined in these environments, even if they have no management zone specific permissions and the list returned by this request is empty.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Group ID path parameter. Missing or empty values will return a 'Bad Request'.

400.description: No ID information received for the request to get group MZ permissions

404.description: Group not found

requestBody.description: The JSON body of the request, containing parameters of the user.

400.description:
Operation failed. The input is invalid. Possible reasons:
 - all required values (ID, email, first name, last name) must be set
 - invalid user data
 - user email address already assigned
 - user group ID does not exist

403.description: Operation forbidden - users and groups are fully managed via LDAP or SSO

404.description: Not found

requestBody.description: The JSON body of the request, containing parameters of the user.

400.description:
Operation failed. The input is invalid. Possible reasons:
 - all required values (ID, email, first name, last name) must be set
 - invalid user data
 - user ID already exists
 - user email address already assigned
 - user group ID does not exist

403.description: Operation forbidden - users and groups are fully managed via LDAP or SSO

requestBody.description: The JSON body of the request, containing parameters of the users.

400.description:
Operation failed. The input is invalid. Possible reasons:
 - no user information received for the create-users request
 - all required values (ID, email, first name, last name) must be set
 - invalid user data
 - input contains duplicated IDs
 - input contains duplicated email addresses
 - user ID already exists
 - user email address already assigned
 - user group ID does not exist

403.description: Operation forbidden - either LDAP or SSO with group assignment integration is turned on

406.description: Unacceptable or incomplete request. Some users added

404.description: Not found

406.description: Not Acceptable. LDAP cannot be turned on if "Import user groups" from SSO flag is turned on

storagePath.description: A full path to the backup archive

includeRumData.description: Include user sessions (`true`) or GDPR compliance (`false`)

includeTsMetricData.description: Include time series metric-data (`true`) or retain configuration data only (`false`))

bandwidthLimitMbits.description: Cassandra backup bandwidth limit in Mbps

maxEsSnapshotsToClean.description: Max number of Elasticsearch snapshots to clean. Elasticsearch snapshots won't be created anymore if there will be more backups to clean than this value.

cassandraScheduledTime.description: Hour to start Cassandra backups each day.

pauseBackups.description: Pauses Elasticsearch and Cassandra backups. In comparison to enable/disable backup, this option does not modify any configuration like Elasticsearch properties.

clusterBackupPath.description: Network attached storage path for the backup

elasticsearchBackupPath.description: Elasticsearch repository used for the backup

datacenterWithBackupEnabled.description: Datacenter for backup, used only in multidc setups

usePublicIpForDomainGeneration.description: If true, public IP will be used for domain generation.

usePublicIpForAgents.description: If true, public IP address will be used for OneAgents.

MigrationState.description: State of in-server config migration for single component

migrationSteps.description: Status of the various sub steps of the migration

SingleToMultiDcMigrationClusterState.description: State of the cluster during migration of single datacenter to multi datacenter and its substeps

InServerConfigDatacenterMigrationState.description: State of in-server config migration for all components

ipAddress.description: Node IP address to remove from firewall

RemoveNode.description: Information which node is going to be removed.

supportSendBilling.description: If true, usage and billing information will be reported.

suppressNonBillingRelevantData.description: If true, usage and billing information will NOT be reported.

supportSendClusterHealth.description: If true, Dynatrace cluster health will be reported.

supportSendEvents.description: If true, Dynatrace cluster health and OneAgent events will be reported.

supportAllowRemoteAccess.description: If true, audited remote-access to your Dynatrace configuration is allowed settings.

remoteAccessOnDemandOnly.description: If true, audited access to your Dynatrace cluster is allowed by approved Dynatrace employees otherwise by privileged Dynatrace employees.

communityCreateUser.description: If true, each new user will be set up as a Dynatrace Community user upon first login.

communityExternalSearch.description: If true, you can search Dynatrace Community and Dynatrace Help when using the product search.

backupEnabled.description: Deprecated. Use the backup configuration endpoint. If true, backups are enabled.

ruxitMonitorsRuxit.description: If true, Dynatrace OneAgent monitors Dynatrace.

helpChatEnabled.description: If true, Dynatrace ONE live chat is enabled.

readOnlyRemoteAccessAllowed.description: If true, audited, read-only remote access to your Dynatrace configuration settings is allowed.

privateKeyEncoded.description: Private key PKCS #8 standard, PEM base64-encoded format

publicKeyCertificateEncoded.description: Certificate X.509 standard, PEM base64-encoded format

example.privateKeyEncoded:
-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----
MIIEow...aHzMvp
-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----

isPasswordConfigured.description: If true, a password has been configured.

allowFallbackViaMissionControl.description: If true, we will send e-mails via Mission Control in case of problems with SMTP server.

useSmtpServer.description: If true, we will send e-mails via SMTP server.

privateKeyEncoded.description: Private key PKCS #8 standard, PEM base64-encoded format

publicKeyCertificateEncoded.description: Certificate X.509 standard, PEM base64-encoded format, server certificate

certificateChainEncoded.description: Certificate(s) X.509 standard, PEM base64-encoded format, intermediate and root certificates

example.privateKeyEncoded:
-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----
MIIEow...aHzMvp
-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----
example.certificateChainEncoded:
-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----
MIIDKT...XbTK+M
-----END CERTIFICATE-----
-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----
MIIDKT...bXTK+M
-----END CERTIFICATE-----

excludedFromDownload.description: If true, update package is excluded from download to save storage

deletedFromMCStorage.description: If true, update package is removed from Dynatrace repository. Once you remove it from your cluster it will be gone permanently.

deleteEnabled.description: If true, it's possible to remove this package via the REST API or the WebUi

readyNodeIds.description: IDs of nodes that have finished package processing (i.e, downloaded or removed depending on status)

fileSizeInBytes.description: Total file size of a package in bytes

countOfTenantsUsingThisAgentAsStandardVe.description: Count of tenants where this agent is configured as standard agent version. Applies to OneAgent type only.

excludedFromDownload.description: If true, update package will be excluded from download and removed from storage. If false, already excluded package will be re-downloaded.

isClusterAdminGroup.description: If true, then the group has the cluster administrator rights.

hasAccessAccountRole.description: If true, then the group has the access account rights.

hasManageAccountAndViewProductUsageRole.description: If true, then the group has the manage account rights.

id.description: Group ID. Leave empty if creating group. Set if updating group.

ssoGroupNames.description: SSO group names. If defined it's used to map SSO group name to Dynatrace group name, otherwise mapping is done by group name

mzPermissions.description: List of management zone models with permissions

mzPermissionsPerEnvironment.description: List of management zone permissions per environment

mzId.description: The ID of the required management zone

permissions.description: The list of permissions for the required management zone

passwordClearText.description: User's password in a clear text; used only to set initial password

groups.description: List of user's user group IDs.

ssoOnly.description: Defines login page type as SSO

testExecuted.description: Indicates whether test was executed at all

testExecutionMessage.description: Additional comments usually indicates why test was not executed

server.description: Address (either IP or Hostname) of proxy server

user.description: User of proxy server, null means do not change previous value

password.description: Password of proxy server, null means do not change previous value

nonProxyHosts.description: Definition of hosts for which proxy won't be used. You can define multiple hosts. Each host can start or end with wildcard '*' for instance to match whole domain.

items.description: Definition of hosts for which proxy won't be used. You can define multiple hosts. Each host can start or end with wildcard '*' for instance to match whole domain.

InternetProxyChangeRequest.description: Configuration of proxy server for Internet connection

server.description: Address (either IP or Hostname) of proxy server

nonProxyHosts.description: Definition of hosts for which proxy won't be used.

items.description: Definition of hosts for which proxy won't be used.

userOrPasswordDefined.description: Indicates if user/password for proxy is configured

InternetProxy.description: Configuration of proxy server for Internet connection

configurations.description: Map of (Data Center name, Proxy) pairs

ProxyConfigurations.description: Configurations of proxy servers for all existing Data Centers

Api-Token.description:
Dynatrace API Token

 The token is passed in the **Authorization** header in the following format: `Authorization: Api-Token abcdefjhij1234567890`.
Api-Token.name: Authorization
